newsitem.title: USA: Computer Assoc trades higher in after hours.
newsitem.headline: Computer Assoc trades higher in after hours.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc's stock rose to 47 in after-hours trading from a close of 44 on the New York Stock Exchange after making an earnings forecast, dealers said.
The company's stock was halted for over-the-counter trading minutes later.
In a conference call for Wall Street analysts, Computer Associates said it projected earnings per share for the fourth quarter to reach $0.90 on revenues of $1.2 billion.
Earnings for the year would likely total $2.54 a share on revenues of about $4.0 billion, it said, adding that the full- year results would include a $598 million charge.
First Call's consensus among analysts forecast a fourth- quarter profit of $0.86 a share and $2.51 for the year.
